content.rendered:
Ahmedabad tourism doesn’t require any sort of introduction as the city boasts of a cluster of tourist attractions ranging from historical sites to alluring sightseeing destinations Teen Darwaza, Bhadra Fort, Shaking Minarets are some of the places where you can witness the historical charm of Ahmedabad. Also, if you want to get some enriching and enticing moments on the tour then visit some of its alluring sightseeing splendors including Vastrapur Lake and Kankaria Lake. This beautiful and rapidly growing city is also popular for the grand celebration of various festivals that are celebrated with great enthusiasm and so much fervor and Uttarayan is one of the most important ones which marks the beginning of the year.

How to Get to Ahmedabad

By Flight

The city has its airport named as Sardar Vallabhbhai Airport which is located pretty close to the city which welcomes various national as well as international airports. Various major cities are connected to this city. Upon your arrival at the airport, one can take a taxi or can hire a private cab to reach their desired destination.

By Train

Anyone who is planning to reach this city by railways can board the train to any of the junctions amongst the Maninagar Junction, Ahmedabad Junction, and Sabarmati Junction. However, the city owns some other railway stations too but these three are the most important railheads where trains from several major cities come. Just after exiting out from the railway junction you can witness taxi drivers shouting to take you to your desired destination.

By Road

Ahmedabad is connected to other cities of the country via all the modes of transportation i.e. airways, railways, and roadways. The roads of this city are well-maintained and are so well connected to the nearby cities by roads. Depending upon your budget you can think of your transport like either you can opt for the bus (if you are concerned with your budget) or can opt for hiring a taxi or a cab to reach the city.
